TopicTitle: Is it possible to reverse the 88-88 Comm Dish to old one?

Articles.Content:
I really don't like the new one, it doesn't fit with my satellite design because it's so big and ugly on it

It might look good with space vessel and station but not with tiny satellite core.

All you'd have to do is configure the old part.cfg and rename it so that KSP doesn't freak out about it. Just copy the antenna partmodule from the new one to the old one and change the animation in that partmodule to the old model's deploy animation.

All you'd have to do is configure the old part.cfg and rename it so that KSP doesn't freak out about it. Just copy the antenna partmodule from the new one to the old one and change the animation in that partmodule to the old model's deploy animation.

you mean the old model still exist in file right? i just need to change the place where it load. Need direction about that :|

you mean the old model still exist in file right? i just need to change the place where it load. Need direction about that :|

No, you need an old version of KSP to get the old model. You can download the last version on Steam by accessing the Beta options for KSP. I think you can download old versions through Squad too if you don't use Steam. Or you can just get the old part folder from someone else.
Since Steam always auto-update, i think the old file already been replace :<
You could also just get the Demo from the KSP website and make a new part entirely (This way you have both).

Since Steam always auto-update, i think the old file already been replace :<

You can turn auto-update off. And there is an option to go 1 version back.
If you have a backup version of the game you don't have this problem. I have .21 somewhere still on my HDD.
